DOC.brief_summary: The purpose propose research conduct feasibility study yoga adjunctive therapy treatment posttraumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) 15 military personnel Walter Reed Army Medical Center ( WRAMC ) Washington , DC . Participants complete 10 week yoga train , addition continue usual customary care PTSD WRAMC . The style yoga chosen study , Yoga Nidra , use deep relaxation , deep breathing meditation systematically reduce physical , emotional , mental , even subconscious tension . After diagnostic mental health assessment baseline , participant attend total 18 class taught 10-week period practice daily home use compact disk provide instructor . Baseline measure include Patient Health Questionnaire , PD-HAT Trauma Questions , PTSD Symptom Scale - Interview , Fear Loss Vigilance Scale , expectation efficacy . The primary outcome measure PTSD Checklist . Changes health status , locus control , pain assessed course study . An additional goal study gather preliminary data anticipate effect size feasibility conduct large clinical study adjunctive use yoga treatment PTSD symptom enlist military personnel .
